nbody

Class Body

  • java.lang.Object
    • nbody.Body

  • public class Body
extends java.lang.Object
    Compilation: javac Body.java Execution: java Body Dependencies: Vector.java StdDraw.java Implementation of a 2D Body with a position, velocity and mass.

      • Body

        public Body(Vector r,
            Vector v,
            double mass,
            double radius,
            boolean customColors,
            int red,
            int green,
            int blue)

        Create the Body object

        Parameters:
        r - is the position of the body
        v - is the velocity vector of the body
        mass - is the mass of the body
        radius - is the radius of the Universe

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public void move(Vector f,
                 double dt,
                 boolean bounce)

        move alters the velocity and position vectors based

        on the forces affecting the body over time

        Parameters:
        f - is the force vector acting on this Body
        dt - is the period of time that has passed
        bounce - is whether or not we want the bodies to bounce off of the sides or not

      • forceFrom

        public Vector forceFrom(Body b)
        Parameters:
        b - is another Body in the system which is pulling on this body

        delta is the distance vector between Body a and b

        dist is the magnitude of delta

        F is the magnitude of the force between the two Bodies

        Returns:
        the force vector

      • draw

        public void draw()

        draw will draw each frame of the animation

        The Body's size on screen is relative to its mass on a logarithmic scale

        I have modified it so that the color of the Bodies changes with their velocity

        I have also modified it so that the Bodies leave tapering trails behind them

        public void draw(double penRadius)
